name: rutile production, synthetic, 95% titanium dioxide, Benelite process | rutile, 95% titanium dioxide | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/24952/documentation

Rutile can be of either natural origin (mined from mineral sand) or synthetic (produced from ilmenite). Synthetic rutile is produced by reducing the iron oxide in ilmenite to metallic iron using carbon monoxide, followed by reoxidation and separation from the TiO2 rich fraction - the Becher process - or leaching with hydrochloric acid - the Benelite process. This activity describes synthetic rutile production using the Benelite process, which is only known to be used in India.

Activity includes crushing of ilmenite to smaller particles, mixing, filtering, washing and drying. The hydrochloric acid can be recycled when using this technology. In this activity (dataset) it is assumed that 95% of the HCl is being returned to the process (recycled).
category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/242:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals/2420:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The production of synthetic rutile from ilmenite by its leaching with hydrochloric acid. The amounts of materials both on the input and on the output are calculated using stoichiometric equation relations. In order to produce 1 kg of  rutile (95% TiO2, i.e. 0.95 kg of TiO2), 1.687 kg of titanium oxochloride (TiOCl2) is needed and 0.867 kg of hydrochloric acid is produced as by-product. 95% of this hydrochloric acid is recycled and returned back to the process. In order to produce 1.687 kg of oxochloride (TiOCl2), 1.922 kg of hydrochloride acid (HCl) and 2 kg of ilmenite (FeTiO3) is needed. When the recycled amount of hydrochloric acid is deducted the make-up amount is then (1.922-0.867*0.95=) 1.098kg.

exchanges.description:
Calculated value. Part (0.02%) of the unreacted amount of hydrochloric acid (HCl) on the input as well as part of the (0.5%) amount of hydrochloric acid which is produced as by-product evaporates to air as chlorine (Cl2). 0.867 kg is the amount of hydrochloric acid produced as a by-product of which 5% evaporates to air as chlorine (Cl2). 95% of the hydrochloric acid produced as a by-product is recycled (re-used) in this activity.
36.461 g/mol is the molecular weight of hydrochloric acid (HCl). 
70.906 g/mol is the molecular weight of chlorine.

Calculated value. Stoichiometric calculation (see equations in the technology description), yield of 95%. Rutile contain 95% of pure titanium dioxide (TiO2).
151.709 g/mol is the molecular weight of ilmenite (FeTiO3).
134.722 g/mol is the molecular weight of titanyl chloride (TiOCl2).
79.865 g/mol is the molecular weight of titanium dioxide (TiO2).

exchanges.description: Calculated value. The unreacted amount of ilemnite entering the activity is released as solids together with wastewater. The WWTP is assumed to have 90% efficiency of treatment, thus 10% of the ilmenite on the input to the WWTP is released to the environment (water) as inorganic solids.

Calculated value based on known demanded amount from the water incorporated in the residue on the output of the activity. Since the residue from the technology contain 56% of water (2kg) there has to be enough water on the input of the technology in order to achieve the water balance. 0.44 kg of water is produced during the reaction, thus additional 1.56kg of water need to be added to be used as process water. Technology efficiency is 95%. Rutile contain 95% of pure titanium dioxide (TiO2).
18.015 g/mol is the molecular weight of water (H2O).
134.722 g/mol is the molecular weight of titanyl chloride (TiOCl2).
79.865 g/mol is the molecular weight of titanium dioxide (TiO2).

It is assumed that all this amount is discharged directly into the environment. 36.461 g/mol is the molecular weight of hydrochloric acid (HCl). 35.453 g/mol is the molecular weight of chloride.

exchanges.description:
Calculated value. Part (0.2%) of the unreacted amount of hydrochloric acid (HCl) on the input as well as part of the (5%) amount of hydrochloric acid which is produced as by-product evaporates to air as hydrogen (H2). 0.867 kg is the amount of hydrochloric acid produced as a by-product of which 5% evaporates to air as hydrogen (H2). 95% of the hydrochloric acid produced as a by-product is recycled (re-used) in this activity.
36.461 g/mol is the molecular weight of hydrochloric acid (HCl). 
2.016 g/mol is molecular weight of hydrogen.

Calculated (stoichiometry). Literature value (Mineral Comodity Summaries, 1996, http://books.google.ch/books?id=agWRXY2pYh8C&pg=PA139&dq=%22synthetic+rutile%22+production+ton&hl=en&sa=X&ei=cGQ-T9m6A4mLhQec_vjMBQ&redir_esc=y#v=onepage&q=%22synthetic%20rutile%22%20production%20ton&f=false) suggest that the amount should be around 1.2kg (100% dry mass). The residue from rutile production has 44% of dry mass (DM), i.e. the final amount of the residue produced is (1/0.44*1.587=) 3.604 kg. 
126.751 g/mol is the molecular weight of iron dichloride (FeCl2).
134.722 g/mol is the molecular weight of titanyl chloride (TiOCl2).
79.865 g/mol is the molecular weight of titanium dioxide (TiO2).
